description:
How absolutely wonderful! Except there are NO -- I repeat NO - Linux applications -- Ubuntu or otherwise that create the required ENEX file. Even Evernote's own linux "web client", available right here in "Ubuntu Software" doesn't export the ENEX file.

So, if you want to switch to Joplin, you've got to go to Windows or Mac (no wine applications work either), which means you have lots of options OTHER than Joplin (Like OneNote, Nimbus Notes, etc).
summary: Evernote ENEX export files can be imported

description: I thought since you had the most rankings and the best explanations that you were going to be the better of the two copies of Joplin on the Snap Store, but this is currently version 1.0.x where as the other one is version 1.7.x. i am not able to synch my data from Drop Box due to this being an old version, so this app will be replaced by the other newer application. Sorry...
Why is everything have to be a snap package ?

OneDrive authorization completed easily.

But sync fails with the message :
Completed: 26/10/2021 11:25
Last error: Error: Sync version of the target (2) does not match sync version supported by client (1). Please upgrade your client.
I tried the app from Snap, but it turned out the sync option didn't work at all. So, the solution was to download an app omage from the Joplonapp website. It has been working flawlessly since.

This is outdated and the one on their site works better. I wasn't able to sync with this, but the AppImage on their site works for me.
I love the program, it's great. this snap however is just old.
summary: The AppImage on joplinapp site is better
